The real estate markets on cusp of S.F.-style affordability crisis

San Francisco’s real estate market is notoriously unaffordable. But one impact of the pandemic appears to be far more areas where the market looks increasingly like San Francisco’s. This data shows the 10 areas where home prices are spiking, and supply is shrinking.

S.F. issues dire warning after spike in fentanyl overdoses among people using cocaine

The health department was alerted to three fatal fentanyl overdoses among people “who intended to use only cocaine but were unintentionally exposed to fentanyl.” Nine similar, nonfatal overdoses were also reported.

Not wanting to fight in war, Russians join migrant crisis at U.S.-Mexico border

A group of Russians are camped out at the U.S.-Mexico border, hoping to be allowed into the United States to stake claims of asylum. They’ve joined a migrant crisis that has only grown more complex because of the pandemic and domestic politics.
S.F. hero who saved dozens from a runaway cable car dies at 76

Charles Gerstbacher, credited with saving dozens of people after a vehicle slammed into a cable car he was operating, shied away from being called a hero. After he retired, his passions led him to Golden Gate Park’s Rose Garden.
